Package ss.pentago.model.board

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • ss.pentago.model.board.Board
  • public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    Board represents the full DIM * DIM Pentago board. A Board can be queried for information about fields and win conditions, and its fields can be updated.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      static int DIM
      The dimension of the Pentago board.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Board()
      Creates a new Board filled with Marble.EMPTY.

      • isFull

        public boolean isFull()
        Checks if the whole board is full, without checking if there is a winner.
        Returns:
        true if the whole board is full

      • isDraw

        public boolean isDraw()
        Checks whether the board is full without having a winner.
        Returns:
        true if the board is full without a winner

      • hasWinning5

        public boolean hasWinning5​(Marble marble)
        Checks if specified Marble has any winning row. It wins if it has at least one row, column or diagonal of 5 of its pieces. This method does not guarantee that that Marble actually wins, since the other Marble might have a winning 5 too.
        Parameters:
        marble - the marble of interest
        Returns:
        true if the mark has won exclusively, false if it's a draw or the game is undecided

      • hasWinner

        public Marble hasWinner()
        Returns true if the board has exactly one winner. This is the case when one of the either Marble.BLACK or Marble.WHITE has at least one row, column or diagonal of 5 of their pieces, so not both can have a win.
        Returns:
        the Marble of the winner, null if no winner (or it was a draw)

      • isGameOver

        public boolean isGameOver()
        Returns true if the game is over. The game is over when there is exactly one winner or the whole board is full (draw) or both win (draw).
        Returns:
        true if the game is over

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Empties the board by setting all fields to Marble.EMPTY.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a basic String representation of this board, showing just the field with marbles.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        the board representation
